description: Leads the governing board; sets agendas and presides over meetings.
Supports/acts in place of the chair as needed.
Records board actions; manages official records and notices.
Elected/appointed governance of the district or school; sets policy and oversees superintendent/head.
Chief executive of a public school district; accountable to the board.
Chief executive of an independent/private school.
Second-in-command over district operations or academics.
Senior executive over major divisions (e.g., teaching & learning).
Executive leader over specific functions or clusters of schools.
Coordinates executive priorities, cabinet operations, and cross-functional initiatives.
Provides legal guidance; manages risk, contracts, and compliance.
Independent, confidential resource for resolving concerns and complaints.
Leads equity, diversity, inclusion initiatives and policy.
Oversees school portfolio and principals; drives performance.
School-site leader responsible for instruction, operations, and culture.
Supports principal in instruction, discipline, operations, and staff supervision.
Senior AP; often leads major school functions.
Leads student conduct, attendance, culture, and MTSS supports.
Oversees curriculum, scheduling, grading, and academic quality.
Oversees a grade’s academic and behavioral support systems.
Leads student activities, clubs, and co-curriculars.
Leads athletics programs, compliance, facilities, and scheduling.
Supports athletic director with operations and compliance.
Leads upper/secondary division in independent schools.
Core instruction in content areas at elementary, middle, or high school.
Subject-specific instruction at high school level.
PE instruction; fitness, health, and wellness.
Targeted literacy interventions and progress monitoring.
Targeted math interventions and progress monitoring.
Job-embedded coaching on pedagogy and curriculum.
Specialized coaching in reading and writing instruction.
Supports novice teachers with induction and practice.
Certified librarian providing instruction and curation.
Extended coverage; curriculum and grading responsibilities.
Residency preparation role co-teaching with a mentor.
Connects families with resources and the school.
Health services, care plans, medication, records.
Supports nurse; first aid and documentation.
Enforces compulsory attendance with due process.
Coordinates supports for students in foster care.
Coaches staff on behavior systems and PBIS.
Manages student records, transcripts, and enrollments.
Front office operations and parent/student support.
Greets visitors, answers phones, and routes inquiries.
Data entry, audits, and SIS support.
Specialist data entry and reports in SIS.
Supports school nurse and health records.
Leads a sport program and coaching staff.
Supports head coach with training and supervision.
Sports medicine, injury prevention, and rehab.
Leads curriculum, instruction, assessment, and school improvement.
Oversees counseling, nursing, social work, and supports.
Leads curriculum adoption, PD, and pedagogy.
Oversees testing, analytics, and program evaluation.
Leads analytics, dashboards, and data governance.
Plans and manages staff learning programs.
New teacher support and certification pathways.
Leads SPED/Exceptional Student Services and compliance (IDEA).
Instruction and services for students with disabilities.
Coordinates IEPs, services, and progress reporting.
Evaluation, counseling, MTSS, and IEP support.
Services for students with visual impairments.
Travel/orientation training for visually impaired students.
Instruction and support for D/HH students.
Leads Section 504 identification and accommodation plans.
ASL/interpretation services for students and families.
Career exploration and work-based learning supports.
Coordinates career/college pathways and work-based learning.
Library program lead; instruction and curation.
Oversees non-instructional operations (facilities, transport, nutrition, safety).
Leads facilities strategy, maintenance, and capital projects.
Oversees site maintenance and work orders.
Leads plant operations at large sites.
Leads routing, fleet, and driver operations.
Student transportation on regular and trip routes.
Student supervision and safety on buses.
Oversees maintenance shop and fleet lifecycle.
Leads USDA-compliant meal programs and kitchens.
Leads security strategy, staffing, and incident response.
Plans drills, response, and recovery operations.
Law enforcement officer assigned to schools.
Leads finance, budgeting, accounting, and fiscal reporting.
Leads talent strategy, employee relations, payroll/benefits, and compliance.
Leads talent sourcing and hiring pipelines.
Leads technology strategy, systems, data, and cybersecurity.
Oversees IT infrastructure, networks, endpoints, and platforms.
Leads district technology vision and delivery.
Alternative title for Director of Technology.
Security policy, controls, and incident response.
Student information system configuration and support.
Directs communications, media relations, branding, and engagement.
Leads comms strategy and media relations.
